coverletter.title: Cover Letter
coverletter.name: David Zhang
content: Dear Hiring Manager,

I am writing to express my enthusiastic interest in joining your team as a Software Engineer Intern. Currently enrolled at New York University, I am on track to graduate in December 2024 with a GPA of 3.6, and I am eager to apply my skills and passion for technology to contribute to your team.

Throughout my academic journey and beyond, I have been deeply engaged in web development and Unity projects. These experiences have allowed me to work with various programming languages, including Java, Javascript, C++, Python, C#, HTML, CSS, and React. In my recent project, I successfully developed a Chat App Website with advanced features, such as encryption, login functionality, and support for saved channels and emotes. My specialty lies in my ability to swiftly pick up and learn new tools and technologies, which enables me to adapt to evolving industry demands.

As a collaborative individual, I thrived in my role as a Software Engineer at Rogue Aerospace, where I contributed to integrating a payload tracking system that required seamless coordination between the Software Engineering and Electrical Engineering teams. Additionally, I served as the technical lead for our university-wide competition team, which achieved an impressive second place. These experiences have honed my teamwork and problem-solving skills, making me a valuable asset in fast-paced and dynamic environments.

To complement my technical expertise, I have obtained certifications as an AWS Certified Database-Specialty and AWS Certified Cloud Practitioner. These certifications showcase my dedication to continuous learning and staying up-to-date with industry trends, which aligns with your commitment to innovation.

I am excited about the opportunity to contribute my knowledge and project experiences to your team. My dedication, creativity, and strong work ethic make me confident in my ability to add value to your team. Thank you for considering my application. I eagerly anticipate the chance to discuss my qualifications further.
Sincerely,
David Zhang

jobs.title: Tutor - Math, SAT, Statistics
content: Teach a variety of subjects clearly and conceptually
Contributed teaching materials and worked collaboratively with other tutors
Adapt to accommodate a variety of different students and timezones

jobs.title: EE/CS Engineer - Rogue Aerospace
content: Worked within EE/CS division in tandem with seperate engineering subgroups
Engineered onboard electronics and programming of competition rocket
Build software to track payload and mitigate data noise

projects.title: Chat App Website
content: Chatting Platform with encryption, login, chat, saved Channels, emote support
Utilized React, and Stream
Engineered seamless communication between multiple users and admin support

projects.title: Payload Tracking
content: Implemented 6 Dof Scanner with Kalman Filters to detect payload dropoff
Preparation to work on NASA competition operations with official team in future

projects.title: Smart Mirror
content: Second place in NYU RAD Competition
Designed a voice-activated hands-free smart mirror
Raspberry Pi, Hardware Integration, UI design, software features
Able to show news/weather/schedule, read off news and play Spotify

projects.title: Top Down Shooter
content: Top-down, bullet hell, shooter
Unique AI Enemies features: lasers, invisibility, fast-chasing, passive behavior
Unity, C#, Particle Effects, Sprites/Maps, Animation, Logic

FeatureProjects.title: Pathfinding Visualizer
FeatureProjects.description: Pathfinding Interface to visualize different algorithms like A* and Dijkstra
